channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump tells Rep. Elise Stefanik she has to stay in Congress instead of becoming UN ambassador because the GOP House margin is so thin
item.description: Trump confirmed he was withdrawing the New York Republican's nomination in a Truth Social post, saying that it was “essential that we maintain EVERY R...

item.title: Trump strips security clearances from attorneys at firm that had employed Robert Mueller
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order Thursday revoking the security clearances for attorneys at WilmerHale, a high-powered Washington law firm th...

item.title: Trump’s executive order puts JD Vance in charge of overseeing efforts to ‘remove improper ideology’ from all areas of the Smithsonian Institution
item.description: The executive order also hints at the return of statues and monuments of Confederate figures.

item.title: Gov. Youngkin says Biden turned US into a ‘sanctuary country’
item.description: Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin told Fox News’ “Hannity" Thursday that former President Biden tuned the United States into a "sanctuary country" with his...

item.title: Elon Musk to give talk in Wisconsin ahead of closely watched state Supreme Court contest: 'Super important'
item.description: Elon Musk says he will be giving a talk to voters in Wisconsin this weekend ahead of the state’s highly anticipated state Supreme Court election.

item.title: There’s Absolutely Nothing But Politics To The Time-Wasting Signal Chat Hullabaloo
item.description: The chat should not have included a journalist, but the error pales in comparison to other egregious acts from Washington's elected leaders.

item.title: A former Mars Wrigley executive making $200k a year stole $28 million from the company and bought a multi-million dollar home
item.description: Paul Steed is accused in a federal indictment of stealing more than $28 million from Mars since about 2013 through various schemes.

item.title: U.K. banks may have to pay out billions of pounds over unlawful car loans
item.description: Millions of drivers would become eligible for compensation if the U.K.'s highest judicial authority sides with borrowers.

item.title: U.S. Supreme Court Takes Up Wisconsin Ruling Stripping Tax Exemption From Christian Nonprofit
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court should overturn the opinion from Wisconsin’s high court and protect the First Amendment rights of all ministries.

item.title: Dem Sen. Mark Kelly fires back after Musk stands by 'traitor' accusation
item.description: Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly of Arizona responds after Elon Musk stands by calling him a "traitor" for arguing that the U.S. should support Ukraine.

item.title: Trump’s JFK Files Release Is About Restoring Americans’ Trust In Government
item.description: The release of the JFK files was never about solving a conspiracy. It was about ushering in a new era of government transparency.

item.title: Trump Urges Votes For Conservative WI Supreme Court Candidate Ahead Of Pivotal Election
item.description: 'I’m asking everyone to get out and vote for a great American patriot, tough-on-crime Brad Schimel,' Trump said during Thursday's tele-rally.

item.title: Second federal judge blocks Trump from banning transgender troops in the military: ‘The government’s arguments are not persuasive’
item.description: Thousands of transgender people serve in the military, but they represent less than 1% of the total number of active-duty service members.

item.title: Diane Sykes: A Model Judge
item.description: The chief judge of the Seventh Circuit is an example for others to follow — including in her decision to retire.

item.title: Why the United Auto Workers Supports Tariffs That Will Hurt Auto Workers
item.description: The union doesn’t represent most autoworkers.

item.title: Maybe It Wasn’t Such a Great Idea to Support a Larger, More Extensive Federal Government for 100 Years
item.description: The Left gets hoist with its own petard.

item.description: The Cinderellas simply can’t compete anymore.

item.title: The Democrats’ Profanity Campaign Is Stupid by Design
item.description: It’s a transparent strategy aimed at conveying authenticity, which undermines the whole point of the strategy.

item.title: Book Review: Themes in Alternative Investments
item.description: This book highlights a cross-section of issues relevant to the current state of alternative investments.

item.title: Year of Shifting Sands: Reflections on the 2024 Global IPO Market
item.description: The dynamics of global capital flows are shifting. While the overall IPO market contracted last year, a closer look paints a more nuanced picture.

item.title: Book Review: Buffett’s Early Investments
item.description: This book digs into Buffett’s pre-Berkshire investments. The result is a fresh look into the origins of his investment approach.
